function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Recirculation of air in the built environment during an epidemic, including COVID-19, can lead to the dissemination of virus-laden particles.","Impact":"Increased risk of spreading the virus within the indoor environment, potentially leading to higher infection rates.","Mitigation":"Avoid recirculation of air by maximizing outdoor air levels, applying filtration or ultraviolet germicidal irradiation to remove or deactivate viral contamination, and installing secondary air circulation systems with outdoor ventilation.","Technologies":"Filtration systems, ultraviolet germicidal irradiation, induction units for ventilation with outdoor air, local air cleaning or disinfection devices such as GUV (Germicidal Ultraviolet) devices.","People":"Building occupants, especially in shared or enclosed spaces where air recirculation occurs.","Owner":"Building managers, maintenance personnel, and HVAC system operators."},{"Description":"Air cleaning and disinfection devices may be beneficial in environments with poor ventilation.","Impact":"Without proper ventilation, the risk of viral transmission within the indoor environment may remain high. Air cleaning and disinfection devices can help reduce this risk.","Mitigation":"Use of local air cleaning or disinfection devices such as germicidal ultraviolet (GUV) in environments where improving ventilation is difficult.","Technologies":"Germicidal ultraviolet (GUV) devices, air cleaning and disinfection devices.","People":"Building occupants and those responsible for maintaining indoor air quality.","Owner":"Building managers, maintenance personnel, and HVAC system operators."}]}
